comments.body: I'd add ListTile here too even though you link it above.  It's easy for quick readers.
There are some unlikely-to-be-useful cases that we should probably assert about. Specifying a leading widget and controlAffinity=leading or likewise for trailing, seem likely to be mistakes.

Specifying a leading widget and controlAffinity=leading allows replacing the default rotating icon with a custom icon. If controlAffinity=leading was not specified, there would be two icons because ExpansionTile would place the default rotating icon at the trailing edge.
Oh, and there's also a test for overriding the icon like this.
